definition: to ratchet up/to raise (expectations etc)/to increase (a quota, a position in the market etc)/to up the ante/(computing) to encode
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
weight/number/code/to pile/to stack/classifier for length or distance (yard), happenings etc
to increase bit by bit/repeated increments

sentences.english: Obama seems to work overtime trying to do just that.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马似乎为了这个目标在超时加码的工作着。

sentences.english: Eric has a dancing background. Hence he will perform more dancing in the anniversary show.
sentences.chinese: 孙耀威跳舞底子不差，所以今次贺台庆特别加码演出。

sentences.english: Conway boosted South Korean equities to “overweight” from “underweight” last month.
sentences.chinese: 康威上月将韩国股票从“减码”提到“加码”的位置。

sentences.english: Please input the correct Verification Code.
The pyramiding plan is simple and easy to use.
sentences.chinese: 加码计划实施起来是非常简单容易。

definition: merger and acquisition (M and A)/acquisition/to take over
to officially launch (a policy, program etc)/to appear on stage/to appear publicly/(of a bar girl) to leave with a client
to make an amphibious assault/to seize a beachhead/to gain a foothold in (a new market)
to try harder/to redouble one's efforts
